sentences: She is physically able to climb the mountain.
My dog is incredibly agile and able to jump high.
Despite his disability, he remains determined and able to adapt.
They've always been able to trust each other's judgment.
She's able to sing beautifully.
Being bilingual has made him more open-minded and able to communicate with diverse cultures.
The old man remains physically able despite his advancing age.
They chose an able-bodied candidate for the leadership position.
He's physically able to climb mountains.
The old couple remain actively able despite their advanced age.
Despite his best efforts, he was unable to solve the complex puzzle.
She felt unable to express her true feelings due to fear of rejection.
The old man was physically unable to climb the steep mountain.
He struggled with memory loss and found it increasingly unable to recall details.
After months of training, he still struggled with mastering basic swimming - unable to swim like others.
The ambitious project encountered numerous obstacles, leaving them unable to progress.
She tried empathizing with him but realized she herself was unable to comprehend his pain.
The restaurant staff were unable to accommodate their large party without additional seating.
The restaurant promised excellent service but fell short with our waiter being completely unable.
The young child was unable to understand complex mathematical concepts initially.
Abaxial furrows on tree bark provide support and protect inner layers.
The abaxial face of snowflakes exhibits intricate hexagonal patterns unseen on their aerial aspect.
Some plants have evolved to manipulate abaxial wax production for better water retention.
During seed dispersal, seeds can be shed from both abaxial or adaxial surfaces.
Abaxial growth patterns differ between plant species; some sprout from their lower parts first.
The abaxial side of leaves often receives less sunlight than their adaxial counterparts.
Researchers studied abaxial tissue's unique functions in the development of new pharmaceuticals.
Abaxial glandular secretions from certain flowers aid in pollination.
The abaxial leaf veins help distribute water efficiently during drought.
Researchers discovered a new species with abaxial spines for protection from predators.
In anatomy class, we studied the spinal cord's dorsal column.
The butterfly exhibits vibrant colors on its dorsal wings.
The whale breaches vertically, propelling its massive body forward with its powerful dorsal flukes.
The whale's dorsal fin is its most distinctive feature.
The coral colony's complex architecture rises from the seafloor, displaying a colorful dorsal surface.
The bird species displays a vibrant red and blue dorsal plume for courtship displays.
The fossilized shark had well-preserved dorsal spines from millions of years ago.
She carefully applied sunscreen to her exposed dorsal areas during her beach vacation.
The dolphin's dorsal fin is its signature mark.
The car engine's exhaust system contains a durable metal component - the dorsal muffler.
Soil nutrients often accumulate more efficiently on the adaxial leaf margin.
The stem's adaxial side is often thicker due to increased water transport.
The flowers on an adaxial branch have larger petals for better pollination.
The adaxial side of the leaf receives more sunlight than the abaxial.
The fruit of an adaxial-facing tree faces downwards for seed dispersal.
Many insects feed primarily on the adaxial surfaces of plant leaves during their larval stage.
In botanical classification, adaxial means upper and outermost.
Adaxial growth is faster and more prominent compared to the abaxial counterpart.
In some insects, the sensory hairs on the adaxial side aid in orientation.
The stem's upper portion, where leaves attach, is known as the adaxial surface.
